title: I can't carry if doing well
body:
Hello, I'm a top lane main and most of the time when i do get top, I win my lane however past that point, I find myself unable to carry whether it be from teammates or we just get beaten in other lanes. 

I'm wondering if there are champions similar to my mains{{champion:75}} {{champion:83}}  that can "Carry" when i get ahead because my two mains often fail in doing so

replies.body: Its not the champions you are playing that are the problem. Nasus can hard carry games when ahead. It must be your play style. If you are a low elo player(gold or below), i would recommend watching videos on how to carry as top laners. The best coach in league atm is Last Shadow 9. His videos go incredibly indepth and he coaches players from all elo's so i would recommend checking out his youtube channel. If you are really looking to improve, try recording some of the games that you win lane yet lose lane in, then watch them back yourself and be hyper critical. Try and figure out what you should have done in each situation. Btw im not sure if you know this, but nasus excels at split pushing and team fighting when ahead, its just about picking the right time to time fight and the right time to split push.

1)Splitpush when the opponent is focused in team fights. This should only be done if your whole team is fed enough and/or able to defend the objective the enemy team is seeking. Even if you don't/can't splitpush, you can learn to slowpush the lane. This can be done by leaving 3-4 enemy minions alive. It will slowly accumulate and push the lane, pressuring the enemy team to either back off and protect turrets or lose turret completely. 

2)Teleport/Roam whenever there's a team fight or somewhere your team can capitalise on. When you see the bot lane having difficulties tp bot and help them win lane (either by killing or gaining objectives such as dragon or turret). Take into account number 1, the position of the top laner and the creep wave. You wouldn't want to lose top turret and unfavourable trades at bottom.

3)Translating to late game, depending on composition, will either be peeling for the adc/apc or diving straight onto the enemy adc. This will heavily depend on the champion, but most Top Laners are the hard engagers of their team (Lissandra, Maokai, Pantheon, Riven etc). You must learn how to zone enemies, engage and peel for a successful team fight. 


Good luck

If you say you're quite good at top lane, try to win the lane quickly i.e. kill enemy a few times and farm up a decent amount. (If you're playing Nasus you might wanna farm up a bit more) but once you've pretty much wrecked the enemy laner, and they're constantly zoned out of lane, roam mid or bot, whichever seems easier. If you have tp then bot lane if they're pressured, otherwise help mid out. 

Also ward the river if your mid lane isn't and constantly look for where the enemy jungler is. That way you can push and be aggressive without worrying about ganks. It creates a ripple effect when you help out your mid, who then helps out bot, who then is back in the game. Of course it wont always work out as planned but just do your best at it.

well, these guys explained most of the thing. But yeah
Learn the Game = Win the Game
Kills does not mean win.
If your nexus is down and u have over 9000 kills on them, it doesn't mean anything
It's probably the fact that when you go on a winning streak you get a higher MMR.

Maybe instead of trying a new champion which you think will help carry the game why not help your teammates to win their lanes too. Get the teleport summoner spell and help your teammates instead of focusing 100% on your own lane and winning them.

Nasus is probably one of the best top laners for carrying in lower divisions. The champion isn't failing to carry, YOU are failing to carry.

Try to take an objective look at your gameplay and work out WHY you're not able to carry games once you have an advantage, rather than looking for a magical fix like a new champion

Irelia {{champion:39}} and Hecarim {{champion:120}} are really strong top laners at the moment, you can easily carry games when you get ahead with either, make sure you TP gank, secure as many objectives as you can when you're ahead and help out your team as much as possible if they're falling behind, the problem with Nasus is he only really excels at split pushing and late game team fights so if you're team is behind and they can't drag the game out into late there's not really much you can do about it even if you're fed, Yorick is... well... he's pretty much worthless outside of the laning phase, he's not an effective split pusher, his late game damage is pitiful, his peel is eh (mainly due to his lack of CC), his ultimate is only useful if a damage dealer on your team actually deals damage and he's a pretty useless team fighter all round (unless your team is strong). 

I would also recommend Rumble {{champion:68}} and Gnar {{champion:150}} but i don't play them that much anymore.
